description.summary:
“Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do”
~Steve Jobs

Have you ever been awestruck by the reach of technology? Does its revolutionary touch on this world dazzle you? Have you ever dreamed of being a tech-savvy pioneer? This is your time! Grab the baton! If you want to make the world a better place, the answer lies in creativity and innovation. Now’s your time to take these problems head on and arrive at remarkable solutions!

Join us in this 24 - hour hackathon and prototype a groundbreaking solution to problems in these topics. Creativity is the greatest rebellion in existence. Can you rebel and innovate a solution to the problems in these areas? Brave against the time crunch and grab this opportunity to win exciting prizes!!!

Topics for Problem Statement
  • Cyber Security
  • Medical and Healthcare
  • Women's Safety
  • Climate Change and Sustainability
  • Fintech
  • Agritech
  • Student Innovation (Open Idea)

The hackathon will have 3 reviews and 1 final presentation over the course of 24 hours. A leader board system will be followed. The points awarded will be the cumulative points, gained by the team over the three reviews and final presentation. The top team will be announced as the winner of the hackathon.
*Decision taken by the review panel will be final.

Platform used: Discord and Google Meet

round_description.name: Schedule
round_description.description:
October 8th:
  • 10.00 AM – Introduction
  • 11.00 AM – Hackathon starts
  • 03.00 PM – First Review
  • 10.00 PM – Second Review

October 9th:
  • 08.00 AM – Third Review
  • 11.00 AM – Hackathon ends
  • 12.00 PM – Final Presentation
  • 03.30 PM – Valedictory

round_description.name: General Instructions
round_description.description:
1. All the team members should have a proper internet connection.
  2. Participants are required to have their own components and software.
  3. Teams will be allotted separate channels on discord, at least one member is expected to be on the channel at all times.
  4. The team are expected to give updates on discord at periodic intervals and the reviews will take place on discord.
  5. Participants will be informed of the order in which reviews will happen and must join their respective channels / meetings at the specified times.
  6. Mentorship for technical skills will be given.
  7. Participants are supposed to build their product during the Hackathon.
  8. Product will be judged based on Innovation, Impact, Feasibility and Marketability.
  9. Product can be a mix of hardware and software technologies, but can be purely software or hardware based as well.
  10. Participants are allowed to use existing libraries or components, however only the work done during the 24hrs will be considered for evaluation.
  11. Organizers will be available on discord for any other help/queries

The team and problem statement details will be collected via Google Forms after all the team members have registered and paid.

Perks: GeeksforGeeks will offer coupons to their exclusive courses to the Winners and all participants.

description.summary: Solve puzzles and break the ultimate code

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description: Aptitude Test based on topics such as General Science and Mathematics, Abstract and Logical Reasoning, Data Interpretation and Basic Programming. Questions will be sent through a Google form.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description: Qualified teams will be given puzzles based on cryptography, steganography, basic digital electronics and logical deduction. First team to complete wins.

description.summary: As the amount of data increases day by day, extracting useful information from raw data has become inevitable. This event will test the participant’s skills in statistics, Machine Learning and Data Science.

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description: MCQ Quiz on Data Science, Machine Learning and Statistics.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description:
Teams will initially be quizzed (max 10 minutes) to test their basics and ensure they start off with appropriate baseline models. Volunteers will guide the team towards the right direction if needed (e.g. suggesting a column of values to be dropped etc.) at the loss of points.
After the quiz, the dataset will be provided.
Teams are expected to perform exploratory data analysis, and implement a model/algorithm to predict the required value for the given test data. Teams will be judged based on the accuracy metrics as well as the predictions.

ECE.name: Tinkering Thoughts

round_description.name: Round 1:Quiz
round_description.description: The quiz tests basic knowledge of microcontrollers, and basic electronics. Every participant will be given a Google Meet link.Based on the number of participants, 5 or 6 teams will be shortlisted.

round_description.name: Round 2:Circuit Simulation
round_description.description: Shortlisted participants from Round 1 will contest in a simulating round. Teams are required to use Tinkercad [open sourced- online software] to design and simulate a circuit. Based on the ranking in the first round, the teams are allowed to choose the projects. If a project is selected, then that project is locked. The teams will be put into breakout rooms.

prizes: Inplant Training for the top two teams

description.summary:
Do you have what it takes to be a master marketer? Hitch on to "The Big Meg", pitch your product and if you are deemed worthy, fetch your reward.

Platform: Google Meet

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description: Participants will be asked to answer a few questions, via a form, related to the sales and marketing techniques of a product. Finalists will be shortlisted after evaluating the answers.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description: Shortlisted finalists will be made aware of a topic. They will be expected to come up with and pitch any product of choice, for a maximum of 7 minutes to a panel of judges. Winners will be ascertained based on a set of judging criteria.

description.summary: Apply the basic principles of electronics, debug the given circuits and arrive at a solution

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description: A technical quiz based on topics such as but not limited to Circuit Analysis, Semiconductor Devices, Analog Electronic Circuits and Digital Electronics. The questions will be sent to the teams as a Google Form which would be time restricted for submissions. Teams will be selected on the basis of points scored. Only one submission per team would be allowed.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description: Qualified participants shall be added to a discord server and would be on a video conference throughout the event. This round would consist of three levels of increasing difficulty. In each level the participants are given a faulty circuit (circuit which does not produce the expected output), they are required to do some changes to the circuit and find the expected output. The output found in a particular level will act as a key to the next level. First team to complete all the 3 levels will be declared as winners.

description.summary: Junkyard Jumble is a super fun semi-technical event that provides both.

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description: This event triggers the participants to arrive at the solution by cracking simple puzzles and identifying well known Physics and Electronics Concepts.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description: This is the Dumb Charades round. The participants must act out questions to their teammates and then, find the answer, all under a ticking clock!

round_description.name: Skills
round_description.description: Logical Reasoning, General Aptitude, Basic Physics, Fundamentals of Electronics and Semiconductors and 11/12th Physics

round_description.name: Round 1:Submission of abstract
round_description.description:
The abstract of the paper of your preference from the given domains must be sent through mail by 3rd October, 2021. The domains are as follows:
  • Antenna Systems and its Applications
  • Augmented Reality
  • Cognitive Science
  • Cybersecurity and its risk assessment techniques
  • Deep Learning
  • Emerging trends in Photonics
  • Internet of Intelligent Things
  • Internet of Things
  • Machine Learning
  • Machine Learning/ AI for networks
  • MEMS
  • Network Security and Blockchain Technology
  • Optical Communication and Networks
  • Robotics
  • Signal and Image processing
  • Virtual Reality

Email id to submit abstract: ssnieeecomsoc@gmail.com

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description: Live Presentation of the shortlisted papers from Round 1. The selected teams from round 1 will be given 5 – 10 minutes to explain their paper and present their idea to the panel of judges LIVE online during the time of the event.

description.summary: "Those are the two best words in English, 'Bidding' and 'War'." - Evan Dougherty

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description: Quiz based entirely on IPL for a duration of 30 minutes.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description: Purse amount will be 80 crores and each team should pick 15 players (11 players in the  playing 11 and 4 in bench) based on the criteria given. Points for the players will be given as per the data available based on 2020 performance in DREAM 11 (IPL 2021 will not be over by Invente).

description.summary: Design is where science and art break even. Sketch X is a design event that will test the creativity and basic design knowledge of the participants.

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description: MCQ round will be conducted based on topics like Design, Colour Theory and Graphic design principles through an online quiz platform.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description: Out of the few topics given on the spot , participants who have cleared round 1 will choose one to design a Poster using any software they see fit(Adobe illustrator, Canva or PPT)

round_description.name: Round 3
round_description.description: The participants will present their poster to the judges explaining the content of the poster and it will be judged based on the pitch, creativity and design. Each poster will be scored by the judges and the co-participants through a vote using an online poll.

BME.name: Paper Presentation

description.summary: The event involves a preliminary round where the registered candidates will have to submit a project   abstract   along   with   the   camera-ready   paper   on   one   of   the   specified   domains.   The submitted   abstracts   will   be   shortlisted   based   on   the   IEEE   paper   norms   (novelty,   socialimpact,   economic   status,   and   implementation   factor).   The   shortlisted   participants   will   be moved to the next round where they have to present a camera-ready pitch before the panelists for 7 minutes with 3 minutes of QA session for each presentation. Based on the innovation factor and pitch presentation mode, the best presentation and best innovation category will be selected by the panelists.

prizes: Best Presentation Award:  Rs.3000 (based on IEEE pitch norms)
Best Innovation Award: Rs. 2000 (based on social and technical novelty)

description.summary:
This event consists of 3 rounds.
The cumulative scores from the previous rounds will be added to the final round.
The person scoring the highest will be declared the winner.
The catch is that the platform Kahoot will rank you based on the correct answer andhow fast you answer the same. So your response time matters ! and try not to waste timesearching for answers which will automatically reduce the response time pushing you to thelast .

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description: Will be conducted in Kahoot.it. There will be 12-20 questions with different timingfor each question based on difficulty level. This will consist of questions from electronics,electrical and other circuit subjects. The quiz will be multiple choice.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description: Top 15 participants from Round 1 will be moved to this round. This round willconsist of solving various types of circuit problems in a given time period. The platform forthis round is also most likely to be Kahoot.it.

round_description.name: Round 3
round_description.description: Top 8 participants from the previous round will participate in the final round. Theround consists of 8 different domains and each participant gets to select one domain fromwhich he/she will be asked questions. The topper of the previous round will get to select theirdomain   first,   followed   by  the   runner   of  the   previous   round   selects   their   preferred   domainfrom the remaining 7 available ones and this continues till the last. Each domain will contain3   to   5   questions   of   higher   difficulty.The   questions   will   be   displayed   to   the   participantsthrough screen sharing in the meeting and  the participants have to fill in the answers in thegoogle form given and submit it within the given time.

description.summary: This event consists of two rounds having a duration of one and half an hour each. Participants in the first round are required to design a webpage under the given topic of any domain. Selected participants are allowed for the second round where they will be designing a webpage for the topics related to biomedical engineering domain.The participants can make use of any platform for developing theirwebpages. At the end of each round the participants are requested to share their designs through an email id (which we will provide you) to assess the results.

Participants are required to design a particular problem statement which we will be providing within a span of time and they'll have to present it to the panel of judges. It'll totally be of 2 rounds. One in which they'll have to design a simple model. This is the screening round, where participants will be selected based on the reality of the designs. The second round will be the one where participants will be asked to produce a novel design of need with respect to any industry and that has to prove beneficial for the consumers. They'd have to explain it to the judges. It's an individual event. Participants should be clear, concise in explaining the aspects of the design. They are even allowed to prepare presentations and can show simulations, animations of the designed 3D Model. Winners will be declared based on theinnovation, uniqueness, aesthetic approach and novelty of the proposed idea.
Platform to be used – Fusion 360, Solidworks, Blender

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description:
Participants are required to design a product (exact 3D model ) of their own and submit it in a portal which we provide them. It has to relevant to the industry needs. Participants will be filtered in this round.
Filtering criteria - Complexity, originality.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description:
Participants are required to design a model which we assign them. Let's say we have a list of 12 models from which they have to choose and design accordingly. The designs should be replicated properly and rendered image has to be submitted for the same. Then they have to explain the innovation in the design to the judges. More the innovation, higher the marks.
Novelty, aesthetics, uniqueness, innovation

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description:
Round 1 will take place before the main event around mid September during which the participating teams (team of 3) should send an abstract mentioning the Problem statement/theme from the list provided by us.

Themes
  • Medical Apps/Remote monitoring
  • AI/ML
  • IoT
  • Vital Monitoring in Space
  • AR and VR
  • Human interfacing devices
  • 3D designing

Abstract should contain
  • Title
  • Description of the design
  • Novelty

Deadline - Oct 1st
Submit the abstract to: inventebiomedicathon@gmail.com
Submissions will be scrutinized and around 10-15 submissions will be selected for the second round. Final list will be sent to the participants within the first week of October.

round_description.name: Round 2 (Main Event)
round_description.description: The review will be conducted by the panel of judges from 3 to 5pm on Day 1 (October 7) and the final presentation (implementing all the suggestions provided by the judge) should be presented on Day 2 (October 8) from 3 to 5pm. The presentation will be limited to 10 minutes. The top three teams will be awarded with prize money.

description.summary: Interested people can register themselves in groups of 3 or 4(preferred). Other individual entries without any group are taken in and later sorted into a group (optional). They are also advised to make a discord or whatsapp group to make discussion among themselves during the auction.

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description:
Base Idea: A good number of medical devices will be put in auction and the teams get to bidfor the devices. All these components will be divided based on their department of use, example imaging - MRI scan, X-ray etc., optical - Autorefractor, Retinoscope, etc. A number of general/must needed devices for hospitals are also kept in auction such as Defibrillators, Anesthesia Machines, Sterilizers, etc. These general devices act as Bonus for teams who buy it. Based on the number of teams who enter the event the number of each components will be increased/altered.

Evaluation: The teams that buy components that relate to each other make more points. To make the evaluation better, teams with more general devices tend to get bonus points. In a situation of tie the amount of money left will be a decisive factor to decide the winner.

description.summary: Are you always brimming with business ideas, but can’t pitch them to anyone? Do you have innovative solutions to existing problems and feel the need to showcase them? Well then, what are you waiting for? Come join us at the Entrepreneurship event, to prove your prowess as an entrepreneurial genius! ✨

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description: The   first   round   will   consist   of   a   situation   type   quiz,   where   the   participants   will   be   given business situations, and they will be marked on the type of answers that they are writing. The participants   will   be   judged   based   on   critical   reasoning,   strategic   thinking,   and   business acumen.   This   will   NOT   be   an   MCQ   quiz,   the   participants   will   write   and   submit   their responses. One member of the team  will submit the responses, but the team members  can discuss amongst themselves. (Elimination round, depending on the number of participants

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description: The second round will judge the participants on their financial and budgeting skills. They willbe given an amount of 1,00,0000 rupees, and will be asked to explain how they will invest theamount into their business. They will need to justify the amounts that they are investing, andprovide the reason as to why they invested in that particular unit of their business. This willbe submitted  to us via a common email.  (Elimination  round, depending on the  number ofparticipants)

round_description.name: Round 3
round_description.description: The final  round will be a presentation  round, wherein the team-members  will be asked topitch their product to us, via a PPT. The areas that need to be covered in the PPT will beconveyed to the participants in advance. The participants’ products will be judged based onpracticality, creativity and economical aspects. The problem that the product is trying to solvewill   also   be   a   major   marking   factor.   The   highest-ranking   participants   will   be   given   theWinner, and Runner-Up position.

description.summary: Reel it is a video meme contest

round_description.name: Preliminary Round
round_description.description: For the preliminary round, a topic will be given on spot to the participants, based on which they have to make a video of 30 seconds and upload it in the given drive link. Participants will be shortlisted in this round by the judges. Decision will be based on Creativity.

round_description.name: Final Round
round_description.description: The shortlisted  participants  will receive  an email  along with the topic for the finalround. Similar to the first round, the participants will have to make a video meme of 30 seconds, based on the given topic and upload it in the same drive link. And, the judges will announce the final winner and runner. Judgement criteria will be Creativity.

round_description.name: DOMAINS COVERED (But not limited to)
round_description.description:
• Smart Grids
  • Soft Computing Techniques in Power Systems
  • Feedback Control Systems
  • Power Electronics and Energy Efficient Drives
  • Renewable Power Conversion Technologies
  • Instrumentation and Control
  • Power Quality Improvement Techniques
  • Expert Systems and Artificial Intelligence Techniques
  • Internet of Things
  • Analog and Digital Electronics/Optimization Algorithms
  • Hybrid/Electric vehicle technology

Or any innovative research work !

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description:
The papers submitted will be reviewed by a panel of judges
  • The research paper should be submitted within the stipulated date to invente.eee.paperpresentation@gmail.com
  • Mention the title of the paper, author’s names in the mail.
  • The last date for paper submission is 07/10/2021
  • The research papers should follow the above rules mentioned
  • The paper will be under review by a panel of judges
  • The panel will take into account the plagiarism Report of the Research papers for the selection process
  • The selected participants will be notified through mail

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description:
This round will be conducted on the Zoom/Google meet/Microsoft Teams platform.
  • Selected participants are required to present their Research work as a Powerpoint presentation during the Final round
  • The Presentation will be followed by a Q & A session with the panel of judges
  • If the event clashes with other events conducted during INVENTE 6.0, contact the Event Heads beforehand
  • The rules will be briefed for the participants when they join the online meeting
  • Participants kindly ensure that stable internet connectivity is available throughout the event
  • Evaluations of Round 1 and Round 2 will be consolidated for final standings
  • The judges’ decision is final

round_description.name: Event Rules
round_description.description:
• Only a maximum of 4 authors and only student authors are allowed. It is not necessary that all authors must be from the same institute
  • he authors can present their paper individually or as a team during the final round
  • Plagiarism is strictly unacceptable.Only original research works are accepted.
  • The paper must be in DOUBLE COLUMN IEEE format. This format must be strictly followed.
  • To refer the IEEE standard, use the link: IEEE Format
  • The paper submitted must be in .pdf format

description.summary:
Communication Platform: Zoom
TOPICS EXPLORED:General Tech! [P.S. Might involve a couple of mild EE Qs for the sake of the department]
Tie Breakers will be involved

round_description.name: Prelims
round_description.description:
• 40 questions. Starred questions will be used for tie breakers
  • Usual pointers applicable
  • Every Breakout Room will have a invigilator to help the contestants and also to monitor whether the rules are abided by the respective teams
  • It is mandatory for every contestant to switch on their audio and video throughout the contest

Quiz Master: Tharun R Prakash/ Sri Hari
Finalists will be decided upon the number of participants [Min 4, Max 6]
(If the number of participants is beyond our wildest dreams, then a semi final round might be conducted)

round_description.name: Grand Finale
round_description.description:
• For the ultimate showdown the finale will be a classic Pounce and Bounce with multiple Quiz Masters and multiple drills all very interactive and breezy contention to crown the champions.
  • The finale will take place via Zoom and all the participants must be make sure their Internet connections is as seamless as possible.

round_description.name: Basic Rules
round_description.description:
• Prelims will not have any negative marking. So does Bounce in finals.
  • In case of a tie at any stage of the contest, the tie breaker will be decided by the respective Quiz Masters and their decision will be final.
  • In case a contestant has network issues in between, grace time will be given in accordance with their situation.
  • Any disturbance from the participant’s side and unnecessary interruptions will not be entertained (Except memes!)

description.summary:
Domains Covered:
  • Power Electronics
  • EDC
  • Analog and Digital Circuits
  • Circuit Theory
  • Machines


General Instructions:
A circuit will be provided in each question. But a mistake is present in the circuit. The team should identify the mistake and type out the correct answer.
  1. There will be three stages : 1. League Stage 2. Eliminator 3. Final Stage
  2. There will be no negative marking. The answer should be concise and precise.
  3. Contestants will be asked to join a Zoom meeting, and will be assigned breakout rooms for their convenience to brainstorm the questions from the Google forms and only one response from a team will be acknowledged for each circuit.
  4. Every Breakout Room will have a invigilator to help the contestants and also to monitor whether the rules are abided by the respective teams. The google form should be screenshared at all times.
  5. It is mandatory for every contestant to switch on their audio and video throughout the contest.
  6. The participants should have their own devices like laptop, charger and must also carry their ID card.
  7. The winners of each round will be announced at the end of each round. The decisions of the Event Heads will be final.

round_description.name: League Stage
round_description.description:
All teams will be given 6 questions to solve in 30 mins.
Each question will be awarded 3 marks. 1 mark for identification and 2 marks for explanation.

Total marks in League stage : 18

round_description.name: Eliminator Stage
round_description.description:
All teams will be given 4 questions to solve in 20 mins.
Each question will be awarded 5 marks. There might be more than one mistake. Each question will be awarded marks based on the identification and explanation of the mistake.

Total Marks: 20

round_description.name: Final Stage
round_description.description:
All teams will be given 3 questions to solve in 20 mins.
Each question will be awarded 5 marks. There might be more than one mistake. Each question will be awarded marks based on the identification and explanation of the mistake.

Total Marks: 15

description.summary: DOMAINS COVERED: Basics of EEE, Field theory, Digital logic circuits, Electronic devices, Microprocessors, Electrical Machines.

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description:
A theme based recreational technical quiz
  • First round is a fun technical quiz conducted through online quizzing platforms.
  • The quiz comprises 20 questions based on the subjects mentioned above.
  • The top six teams will be qualified to the next rounds.
  • The team members can connect through a discord server to discuss among themselves.
  • There will be no proctoring for the first round.
  • Quiz link can be accessed only through the registered email id.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description:
Unlocking knowledge at the speed of thought!
  • The qualified participants will be intimated through the registered email id.
  • There are eight levels and correct answers will take the participants to the next level in the maze.
  • Mix of technical and non technical questions (bonus) .
  • There will be a time limit for each question.
  • The fastest team to reach any level will have an edge in case of ties.

description.summary:
IDEATE:  It is an extended hackathon that kindles the passionate engineering minds to shape up their attractive ideas, that serves to solve a real-time problem or as a token of technological advancement.

DOMAINS
  • Internet Of Things – IoT
  • Crisis Response
  • Smart Security
  • Healthcare
  • Mobility
  • E- Technologies
  • Women Safety
  • Open Innovation

    • If your idea doesn’t fall under the domains specified, don’t worry!! Put it on under Open Innovation and get a chance to feature as a winner!!

round_description.name: General Instructions
round_description.description:
• Valid ID proofs, Laptop, Chargers, working webcam and other hardware equipments needed for completion of the hackathon is mandatory.
  • There should be a hardware which could be accompanied by a software.(Contact for further enquiries on this)
  • Ensure to have a stable internet connection.
  • Participants are requested to stick on to the timelines for a seamless experience at both ends.
  • The judging will be based on their novelty, feasibility, innovation quotient, business model and relevance to problem statement.
  • Reviews will be done at each stage and credits secured will be considered for evaluation.

round_description.name: Phase 1: (Registration)
round_description.description:
• Team Registration and domain selection has to be done.
  • Submission of Abstract by October 3rd,2021
  • Send your abstracts to the Mail ID : inventeideate2021@gmail.com


Format for Sending Your Abstract:
  • Team Name:
  • Team Leader(SPOC):
  • Team Member Details: Name, Mail ID, Contact Number
  • Domain Chosen:
  • Problem Statement:
  • Objective:
  • Abstract:
  • Application:

Share in the form of TeamName_Domain.pdf
Shortlisted Ideas from Phase 1 will move further
Shortlisted Teams will be shared the format for further rounds of evaluation. The date and time for the rounds will be communicated to the shortlisted teams.

round_description.name: Phase 2: (Preliminary Evaluation)
round_description.description:
• Participants will be evaluated based on their workflow (Progress, Improvement, Involvement by team members)
  • Participants are requested to submit the Technology Stack and other data related to the project (Till the point they have completed)
  • Format will be shared via Email

round_description.name: Phase 3: (Secondary Evaluation)
round_description.description:
• Participants should submit their working videos of the project and explain it in the same.
  • Format will be specified post event kick start

*Points gained in Preliminary and Secondary Evaluation will also be considered for result

round_description.name: Phase 4: (Final Pitching) on the day of Invente
round_description.description:
• Participants will have to pitch their project to a judging panel
  • Each team will be given 20 minutes for presentation.
  • The projects may be evaluated on following criteria :
    1. Feasibility and User-friendliness
    2. Relevance to Problem Statement and Novelty
    3. Business plan and marketability
    4. Impact on the society
    5. Sustainability and Quality
    6. Creativity and Scalability
  • There will be a Dry Run (not for evaluation) before commencement of phase 4, for the participants to get used to the environment.

If teams are tied with the same points, there will be a tie-breaker round, which will happen either before or after Phase 4 (Further details will be given during the process, if at all a tie occurs).

description.summary: Arduino Lads here is a place to prove yourself unique among the crowd. This is a great opportunity to showcase your skills in electronics and microcontrollers using Arduino and compete with other innovative participants. We welcome you all to participate in one of the best tech symposiums in town and win exciting prizes. Get Ready, Set, Code!!!

round_description.name: General Instructions
round_description.description:
• Valid ID proofs, laptop, working webcam and mic needed for completion of the competition is mandatory.
  • Ensure you have a stable internet connection.
  • Arduino IDE installed and running.
  • Basic knowledge of Microprocessors and Microcontrollers is needed.
  • Hands on knowledge of Arduino.
  • Possession of an Arduino board and related hardware is advantageous.

round_description.name: Round 1 (Quiz)
round_description.description:
Topics: Microprocessors and Microcontrollers, basic electronics and Arduino
  • The quiz will be timed.
  • Both marks and time of submission will be considered for evaluation
  • No negative marking
  • The questions will be a mix of MCQ’s and Arduino code debugging
  • Briefing will be given before the start of the event

Evaluation Criteria:
  • Correct Answer for MCQ
  • Time of submission
  • Logic, execution, feasibility for the code debugging

Shortlisted teams will move forward for Round 2 (In case of tie-breaker, further evaluation will be done which will be specified during the time of event)

round_description.name: Round 2 (Inventino)
round_description.description:
Mode: GMeet / Zoom / Cisco Webex
  • Participants will be shown Arduino based projects. The number of projects shown will be equal to the number of shortlisted teams.
  • Participants are required to demonstrate the project they are assigned in hardware. In case the team doesn’t have a board with them, they can share their code with their assigned organiser who will test the code and show the output.
  • Teams will be allowed to choose the project of their preference from the given projects based on their performance in the first round.
  • An event organiser will be assigned to each team who will be in possession of an Arduino board.
  • Teams can send their code for debugging how many ever times they want within the specified time frame.

Codolympics is a Competitive programming event in which the participants will compete in teams of 2 or individually taking part in a programming contest where they would be given the task of solving 5 - 7 DSA related problems. The theme of problem statements will be related to the theme chosen for invente to make the problems fun and exciting.

Ranking of teams is based on the standard ICPC rules, namely: First on the number of problems solved (more is better). In case of a tie, the total time for all accepted submissions is taken into account (less is better).

Time is measured from the beginning of the contest until the submission was accepted, where each rejected submission adds 10 - 20 minutes penalty time.

If there is still a tie, the time of acceptance for the last problem solved matters (less is better).

The rounds will be hosted on Competitive Programming platforms, i.e Codechef,Hackerrank or Hackerearth. Problems may vary (considerably) in difficulty, and appear in increasing order of difficulty.

But time is not on your side in this event as the first team to figure out all the clues and solve the murders, wins.

round_description.name: Prelims
round_description.description: A qualifier round which consists of a mini CTF to familiarize yourself with the concept and see if you've got what it takes!!

round_description.name: Main Event
round_description.description: A controversial content creator is found dead and the official report states that it is a suicide. You stumbled across their page recently and found some hidden messages that make you suspect that some foul play is involved. Unsurprisingly, OLEN, the production house that the content creator was a part of contacts you and wants you to retrieve the data from the victim’s erased system. But you find something more sinister as you keep digging. Can you get to the bottom of this before whatever killed the content creator gets to you as well?

description.summary: Every student who wishes to land a dream job looks forward to the Campus Placements season and a “mock-test” before the tense finals is only fair! Mock Job Drive is a realistic simulation of the campus recruitment process, where each round is an eliminator round.

round_description.name: Aptitude Test
round_description.description: The traditional first round of most candidate hiring processes. This is an initial MCQ-based round which focuses on aspects like Computer Science Fundamentals, Logical Reasoning, Aptitude, Quant and English.

round_description.name: Coding Test
round_description.description: An integral part of all IT/CS sector jobs that tests your soundness in data structures and algorithmic thinking. You’ll be given two coding questions along with sample testcases and shall be expected to code up the solution in a popular programming language of your choice.

round_description.name: Technical Interview
round_description.description: A face-to-face interview that tests participants on various technological aspects based on their résumé, skills and qualifications. You shall be asked to explain about your relevant experience and come up with interesting solutions to our on-spot problems that test your problem-solving skills.

round_description.name: HR Interview
round_description.description: The final face-to-face interview round which will judge your job fitness on based on your personality, traits and behavior. You will be tested on common HR pattern questions and asked to provide anecdotes of relevant incidents in your life. You will be assessed based on your candor and attitude.

description.summary: Do you like thinking in reverse? If so this is the right place for you. You can crack it even if you are a beginner! Do register and showcase your skills.

round_description.name: Fast and Furious Wins the Race:
round_description.description:
Every race has got to have qualifiers.
Your team of 3 will have to clear the hurdles , a series of fast paced questions where you get to answer the poll, the first 5 to the finish line qualify!!

round_description.name: Relay in Reverse
round_description.description:
Won a race by running in reverse? Not possible right!
If possible, can you win it? Let's make it more fun! How about a relay?
All you have to do is come up with a solution for the problem, receive the baton, start coding, pass the baton.
You win if you come first , well obviously in REVERSE

description.summary:
When we were stuck at home with the seemingly endless lockdown, we didn’t know when we would hang out with our friends next. That is when we turned to online games to have fun and play with them. These games were not just a stress-buster but were sometimes the only thing we looked forward to during the day.
If you are looking for an exhilarating, fun event before getting all technical, this event is for you.

round_description.name: Wheel Of Fortune
round_description.description: Initially individual players will be randomly split into teams and each team will be assigned to a game chosen by the Wheel of Fortune. Neither you or we would know what game will be chosen to play beforehand. These are games which you might definitely know considering the fact that they are common Party Games. Volunteers will be present in each break out session and will guide you through the process. Winners in each event will be selected and they will proceed to the second and final round of the event. The fact that you will not be knowing which game you’ll be participating prior to the round adds to the mystery of the event.

round_description.name: Trivia Night
round_description.description: The final round is a trivia nite where players test their knowledge against time.

description.summary:
The "Architecture at zero" is a technical competition which aims to bring together multi-disciplinary teams active in the design and construction industry to present a building redesigning project using the various Building Information Model (BIM) toolsavailable in the market . The Competition’s objective is to promote practical uses of BIM through collaborative and competitive learning approach among tertiary students in construction related disciplines.
Platform: MS Teams

round_description.name: Description
round_description.description: Architecture at zero is an event to showcase your talent and skills in designing. You will be given with a problem statement for which you have to come up with an innovative design. You can use any software like Revit, Staad Pro, Auto cad, Sketch up, etc.

round_description.name: Instructions/Requirements
round_description.description:
• Make sure you a have a software for designing installed in your PC/ laptop before the commencement of event.
  • The problem statement will be given to the participants in the morning of the event day.
  • Make sure you upload the design at specified site in Ifc format in BIM
  • The design must be submitted before 11 AM on the 2nd day.
  • The design would be scored and the results would be declared on the 2nd day
  • The winners would be awarded with prize money.

description.summary:
A technical event comprising of questions to test our knowledge. The participants are split into teams. Event comprises of 2 rounds and the teams for round 2 are chosen with points and bonus obtained from the round 1 . The winning team with highest score are rewarded with exciting prices.
Platform: Microsoft teams and kahoot

round_description.name: Round 1: Qualifier
round_description.description:
• 45 minutes test comprising of 30 questions
  • The quiz will happen in Kahoot with time duration
  • teams with the top scores will qualify to round 2 which is the final round
  • Please do note that depending upon the participation count only, the ones who are qualifying to the final round will be determined

round_description.name: Round 2: Finals
round_description.description:
• The qualified participants will take the test in Kahoot
  • This round will have about 15 questions with 25 minutes duration
  • The team with the highest score will be declared the winner

round_description.name: Note
round_description.description:
The questions will be screen shared and the participants will have to enter the nickname and contest through their mobile phones

A video description will also be sent to the contestants to make them familiar with the Kahoot platform

description.summary:
"Perspective""Many can pack the cards but a few can play the game". All of us claim to study but only a few of us can delve deep into the subjectin order to present what we have gained from our studies. Quite often a person's presentations go through our ears, only a few get attached tothe heart, expand to the limbs and are finally established in actions. Presentations, now a days, are an indispensable part of the corporate sector. People wanting to move mountains in future must begin by carrying small stones and this is the impetus of this technical paper presentation.The purpose of this technical paper presentation is to judge efficaciouslyhow skilled we are in our own fields.
Platorm: Zoom/Google Meet/Microsoft Teams

Topic/Domain of Paper Presentation: Recent Advancements in Civil Engineering

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description:
1. An abstract of (150 to 300 words) has to be sent to the organizing team through mail ID paper4invente6.0@gmail.com
  2. The selection criteria will be based on the uniqueness of the topic.
  3. All the entries from various colleges will be evaluated and shortlisted by the chair and secretary.
  4. Authors of shortlisted papers will be notified for the next round.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description:
1. The selected participants will be provided with a Google meet/ Microsoft teams/Zoom link. They will be requested to login at least 5 minutes before the start of the event.
  2. All the participants except the speaker will be requested to mute their audio and video.
  3. Every participant is required to ensure stable internet connectivity throughout the event.
  4. In case of internet instability, one can leave the meet and re-join, but presence of first author is must for the entire stretch of the event.
  5. They will be explained about the event, panel ofjudges, judging criteria, and prizes.
  6. The first author will be then intimated to submita video recording of their presentation time limited to 5 minutes. They will be provided an hour to submit their presentation.
  7. The panel will then evaluate the presentation. During the evaluation of presentation, the participants and the panel will be provided a zoom/google meet link. Once the panel finishes the evaluation of presentation, they can immediately shoot their questions to the authors of the corresponding presentation and assess them.
  8. Evaluations of Round 1 and Round 2 will be consolidated.
  9. The team with the highest score will be declared as the “Best Student Presentation”.
  10. All participants shortlisted for Round 2 will be given participation certificates.

description.summary: Clash of minds is an elegant, modern form of debate which involves a team of students working to effectively convince a judge that their side of a resolution is,as a generalprinciple, more valid. Students in debate develop balanced leadership skills by researchingmultiple perspectives extensivelyto understand both sides of the resolution, and learn to think critically about every argument that could be made on each side. Below are two exciting forms of debate for our Indian students.These events facilitate student collaboration.

round_description.name: Format
round_description.description:
First for affirmative Speaker: 3 minutes
First against affirmative Speaker: 3 minutes
Second for affirmative Speaker: 3 minutes
Second against affirmative Speaker: 3 minutes
Final rebuttal rounds (One from each team) : 2 minutes (protected time)
Debate topics will be disclosed for the preliminary knockout round, 2 days before the start of the event to the participant teams registering online.

Cross College teams (except SSN Students teams) are allowed.

description.summary:
"Successful negotiation is not about getting to 'yes'; it's about mastering 'no' and understanding what the path to an agreement is."

Deal or no deal is a technical event where the negotiation skills of the participants are tested. All the participants will be split into 2 groups - the dealers and the buyers. A certain number of properties will be divided equally among the dealers and a certain amount of cash will be divided equally among the buyers. The buyers are supposed to buy as much properties as they can with the money they have and the dealers are supposed to earn as much money as they can with the properties they have. The best negotiator among the dealers would be the one who has the most cash at the end of the event. And the best negotiator among the buyers would be the one with the most number of properties at the end of the event. Top 3 negotiators from the buyers and top 3 negotiators from the dealers will be selected and among them the winner will be chosen by the judges and will win exciting prizes!

round_description.name: Instructions
round_description.description:
Platform: Microsoft Teams
A Role will be provided to you either as a BUYER or as a SELLER. Both will be provided with common & confidential information about your deal.
Do not discuss your role with anyone before completing the negotiation.
Read your role carefully in the given time so that you understand the facts before you begin negotiating.
Act out your role. Do not say that “The role says that I am Supposed to do this”, Just Do It!
You can add facts, but only if they DO NOT CHANGE any Facts in your role.

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description:
For reading -10 minutes
For negotiation -15 minutes
Participants will be paired up in such a way that one will be a buyer & other will be a seller.
Each pair will be put into a breakout room and thenegotiation will monitored by the event organiser.
Most profitable dealer of each pair will advance to the next round.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description:
For reading -20 minutes
For negotiation -20 minutes
Same as round 1
Best profitable dealer wins first place.

description.summary:
Usually there are three solutions to every problems :accept it , change it or leave it...If you can't accept it , change it and If you can't change it ,think more because there must be no chance of leaving it.....

So solution au probléme is a technical event which will give u some statements of technical problems. You have to choose a statement and bring us right solution for it. Teams can refer any material and have to submit your abstract before end time. The best abstracts will be shortlisted for presentation of their idea. Based on presentation of abstracts, teams will be selected for final presentation in which yourppt work , innovation and changes you done by review of reviewers. Finally the best teams will be chosen as winners and review panel decision will be final

round_description.name: Problem Statement:
round_description.description: 3 problem statements will be given out of which the participant/team is required to choose any 1 statement and come up with a solution within the specified time limit. The abstract should be presented for the same.

round_description.name: Instructions
round_description.description:
• It is not necessary that all participants must be from same institute.
  • All the team members should have proper internetconnection.
  • Abstracts should be submitted on or before October 6th , 8PM.
  • The teams with the best abstracts will be shortlisted for the presentation of their idea.
  • Participants are required to make their own arrangements and are allowed to refer any material (including internet sources).
  • Participants are supposed to present their idea after the selection of the first review (abstract selection).
  • The presentation of the idea will be judged based on Innovation, Impact, Feasibility and Marketability.
  • The second review will be conducted 4-5 days prior of the final presentation.
  • Participants are requested to register their team and send in their abstract before the deadline using the form (will be provided soon).
  • The final presentation should not exceed 15 mins.

round_description.name: Evaluation Criteria
round_description.description:
First Review

Teams are expected to submit an abstract of their idea.
In this round, teams will be evaluated based on the innovative approach of their problem statement and the clarity.

Second Review

This review is a checkpoint to track the team’s progress.
The reviewers will give their input and their thoughts on the team’s solution and changes if there are any.

Final Presentation

Teams are expected to implement the changes given in the previous review by the reviewers.
In this round, teams will be evaluated based on their PPT presentation, ability to explain their idea and innovation in their solution.
Teams which address the marketability of their idea will be awarded additional points.
The build-a-thon will follow a leader board system.The points awarded will be the cumulative points, gained by the team over the two reviews and the final presentation. The top team will be announced as the winner of the Solution au probleme.

Decision taken by the review panel will be final.

description.summary:
“Too many people spend too much time trying to perfect something before they actually do it. Instead of waiting for perfection, run with what you got and fix it along the way...”
Unscripted is a semi technical event that tests an individual’s extemporising skills. This event includes two challenging rounds in which the each participant will be assigned a topic related to civil engineering and they are expected to showcase their extemporising skills by speaking atleast 3 minutes about their topic. A preparation time of 1-2 minutes will be allotted for each participant. Based on their speaking skills and the content they deliver, participants will be chosen to advance to round 2.
The success of your presentation will be judged not by the knowledge you send but by what the listener receives. The winner will be selected based on the judges scores and will receive exciting prizes.

Platform: Zoom

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description:
• Participants will be given a generic topic.
  • Maximum of 5 min will be awarded to each participant for preparation.
  • Each participant will be given a speech durationof 3-5 min(can vary if needed)
  • Based on the performances, participants will be shortlisted for next round.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description:
• Shortlisted participants will be given an another topic
  • Preparation time for each participants will be reduced based on the potential of competing participants.
  • Top 2 participants who excel in their speeches by adhering to the given topic will be awarded.
  • Judges decision is final.

description.summary: A technical event where a certain set of problem statements will be given to the participants. Participants are expected to come up with a design-cum solution for the given problem statements. Problem statements shall propose a need of Solution for building's requirement of suitable pipe connections and water distribution and management within the building based on the given datas, which will be provided along with the problem statement. Top  2 winners will be declared,and rewarded with exciting cash prices.

round_description.name: Problem Statement:
round_description.description: A problem statement will be given to the participant/team for which the participant/team is required to come up with a solution within the specified time limit. The problem statement will be provided to the participants through mail (1 or 2 days before first review).

round_description.name: Instructions
round_description.description:
• It is not necessary that all participants must be from same institute.
  • Participants are required to make their own arrangements and are allowed to refer any material (including internet sources).
  • Participants are supposed to present their idea after the selection of the first review.
  • The presentation of the idea will be judged based on Innovation, Impact, Feasibility and Marketability.
  • The First review will be conducted 1 day prior of the final presentation.
  • Participants are requested to register their team and send in their design-cum solution before the deadline using the given platform (will be provided soon).
  • The final presentation should not exceed 15 mins.

round_description.name: Evaluation Criteria
round_description.description:
First Review

Participant/Teams are expected to submit the design-cum solution of their idea.
In this round, teams will be evaluated based on the innovative approach of their problem statement and the clarity.
The reviewers will give their input and their thoughts on the team’s solution and changes if there are any.

Final Presentation/h3>Teams are expected to implement the changes given in the previous review by the reviewers.
In this round, teams will be evaluated based on their presentation, ability to explain their idea and innovation in their solution.
Teams which address the marketability of their idea will be awarded additional points.
The Bob the Plumber will follow a leader board system. The points awarded will be the cumulative points, gained by the team through the first review and the final presentation.
Top 2 winners will be declared based on the points awarded to them.
Decision taken by the review panel will be final.

description.summary: A non-technical event filled with challenging rounds to the basic knowledge and memory/recollecting power of candidates for the Netflix shows they binged throughout the lockdown. This event sure does need quick-witted individuals who have general awareness and the necessary trivial skills for the topic. We assure you that this event will test the only work done by the individuals during lockdown and will work as a stress buster yielding great rewards.

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description:
• It is a rapid fire round.
  • This round consists of Picture based questions and MCQ’s.
  • It has 20 questions [ Picture based questions – 10 ; MCQ’s – 10].
  • This round will be conducted in “Kahoot app”.
  • The questions will be shared in zoom meeting and the participants will have to answer the questions in the kahoot app.
  • Refer this video[ https://youtu.be/V4FQ-j91waA] to get a clear idea about the Kahoot app.
  • Participants with higher scores will be shortlisted for the next round.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description:
• This Round will have 20 one word questions without choice.
  • The shortlisted participants will be assigned serial numbers based on theirs scores starting from highest.
  • The question will be asked to the participant with the serial number one , if he or she is not able to answer, then the question will be passed on to the participant with the next serial number. This continues until either the question is answered or nobody knows the answer.
  • Finally the participant with the highest score will bethe winner.

description.summary: A non-technical event based on the game - VALORANT. Valorant is a team-based first-person shooter(5 Vs 5). Players can select an agent from a variety of choices who have their own unique abilities. This game has gained huge popularity in today's gaming world. Both team take turns playing attack or defence and battle their way to get 13 round wins in order to secure the match point. This game requires team co-ordination and communication skills in order to win. Two teams flying on top of the leaderboard will be given exciting cash prices.

round_description.name: Rules
round_description.description:
• Any 2 out of 5 must register.
  • Participants must follow the rules.
  • Rules regarding the game and teams will be notified after registration.
  • Stage 1 is knockout stage. Winners qualify for successive rounds.
  • Final round will be a best of three. (Based on final two teams convenience the Finals will be conducted either on the same day or the next day)
  • All general Valorant rules applied. No third party hacks are permitted, if found the entire team will be eliminated.
  • Map selection and other details will be shared in our discord server after registration.

Mechanical.name: Paper Presentation

description.summary:
Platform: Zoom/GMeet
No of rounds: 2

round_description.name: Domains Covered
round_description.description:
• Manufacturing
  • Thermal
  • Design
  • Robotics

(Duration: 8m/presentation)

round_description.name: Rules
round_description.description:
• Only a maximum of 4 authors and only student authors are allowed.
  • Initially, the paper abstract must be sent through the mail.
  • Shortlisted teams based on abstracts will be called for a presentation.
  • The shortlisted teams must send their research papers through the mail.


The instructions are as follows:
  • The subject must be the title of the paper.
  • The body of the email should include- Name and Institute of the participant (from the first author till the fourth one), Department and Year, Contact numbers, Email addresses.
  • Paper as an attachment.
  • The paper must be in two columns IEEE format. This format must be strictly adhered to. The paper length must be limited to 6 pages.
  • The paper must be in .pdf format.
  • Plagiarism is a very serious consideration. Only original research works accepted.

prizes: Winners and runner-up will be announced for each domain

description.summary:
Platform: Zoom/GMeet
No of rounds: 1

round_description.name: Rules
round_description.description:
1. Registration for the event must be done through the provided platform viz. Google forms, Google Sheets, etc.
  2. The projects can be from any field in Mechanical Engineering.
  3. A team can either present their projects live in the zoom meeting or send a recorded video explaining the project (video length is 8 min. max)
  4. After the presentations, participants must be present in the zoom meeting as judges can ask questions.
  5. Winners of the contest will be decided based on the evaluation by the judges.

description.summary: Are you an automobile enthusiast? This event is just for you. Join us for this fun filled unorthodox quiz and win exciting prizes!

round_description.name: Prelims (Online MCQ):
round_description.description:
• This is a technical quiz round covering an assortment of topics from automobile, conducted using Kahoot!
  • Use the above link to get accustomed to the interface
  • A total of 20 questions
  • Time duration per question will be brief to prevent malpractices
  • Of this, ‘n’ teams will be qualified for the finals

round_description.name: Finals (Traditional: Turn wise):
round_description.description:
• All team members will have to be present in the meeting; will be conducted via Zoom
  • The team leader’s answer will be assessed as final answer from the team by the quizmaster
  • This round will be in Wager mode (betting, don’t worry, no real money!)
  • Initially each team will be given 10,000 points in their wallet
  • There will be 5 rounds of questioning
  • Questions will be asked turn wise, no bouncing of questions (i.e.) If a team doesn’t know the answer or gets the wrong answer, the question will not be passed to other teams
  • There will be 6 themes to choose from (all pertaining to automobile)
  • Before questioning each team, the team leader will have to choose the theme of the question and stake the amount he/she is willing to bet
  • If the team gets the answer right, they’d gain the amount equal to the staked points, else if the answer is wrong or they skip, the amount will be deducted from their wallet
  • After the team chooses a particular theme for one round, no other team will be able to choose the same theme in that round (for fair play, each round will start with a different team)
  • The team with the most points at the end of 5 rounds will be declared as the winner. Tie breaker round will be reserved if similar points are retained

round_description.name: Rules:
round_description.description:
• The participants will receive a google form one day before the event and only the team leader should fill the form entering their team details.
  • 15 minutes before the scheduled start time of the round, every participant will receive the online meeting link to their registered email ID.
  • The team members can connect through zoom or meet or any means to communicate among each other.

description.summary:
Mechathlon is a mock interview drive that will prepare you for placements. This event follows the same pattern as most placement interview sessions. Register and experience the placement process!

Platform: Zoom
No of rounds: 3

round_description.name: Round 1: Quiz
round_description.description:
• First, all participants are asked to join a Zoom meeting for giving Instructions.
  • The quiz is created in google forms and added to a free timer google workspace app called ‘Quilgo’
  • Official email IDs are asked to be sent in the chat box, and the quiz link is sent to them.
  • They are asked to attempt the quiz and the meeting is closed.
  • The quiz contains 30 questions with 16 technical and (7+7) aptitude and general knowledge.
  • Technical questions are taken from SOM, FM, Thermal, Design, KOM, DOM.
  • In case the number of participants is 60+, the number of shortlisted students will 25+. In this scenario, we will further shortlist the candidates by conducting an oral quiz
  • An oral quiz will be conducted on the Zoom platform in groups of 6 or 7. Students will be allotted a number from 1 to 6 (or 7).
  • Questions will be asked orally and if a student knows an answer, he/she will post his own number in the chatbox. The first person to get the correct answer wins a point.
  • Videos of the participants should be ON for this round.
  • If more than 20 seconds pass and no one has an answer, we move to the next question.
  • 15 students are shortlisted from this quiz

round_description.name: Round 2: Group Discussion
round_description.description:
• Group discussion will be conducted and judged by one or two faculty members.
  • Zoom or Google Meet platform can be used for this round depending on the preference of the faculty.
  • 3 sessions with 5 students in each session will attend the GD.
  • The top 3 students will be selected from the entire round and they will be the finalists.

round_description.name: Round 3: Interview
round_description.description:
• The interview is held by a committee of professors
  • The finalists enter the Zoom chat room one by one to attend the Interview.
  • Two winners will be selected by the professors.

description.summary:
We know you would rock in your domain. We know you would also manage time. But What if we tell you that you will have to manage both! So here we are to challenge your technical skills but not compromising on the time!

Platform: Quizizz and Zoom
No of rounds: 2

round_description.name: Round 1: QUICK QUIZ
round_description.description:
1. Each team will consist of 2 players with no substitutions allowed.
  2. The participants of the team will get a mail consisting of the zoom meet link.
  3. Official email IDs are asked to be sent in the chat box, and the quiz link is sent to them. The quiz will be conducted on an online platform known as Quizizz.
  4. Only 1 member from the team is allowed to participate in the quiz with the name of the team in the space provided for the name. No duplications.
  5. The Quiz contains a total of 15 questions with each question given a max time of 20 secs.
  6. Coordinators will be available in the meeting throughout the quiz so as to answer any queries.
  7. Top ‘n’ teams will be qualified for the next round, depending on the no. of entries.
  8. Question type : MCQs from the basic fields of Mechanical.

round_description.name: Round 2: TABOO
round_description.description:
1. This is the final round conducted on Zoom, wherein the top ‘n’ teams from the previous round are selected.
  2. Videos of all the participants must be switched ON for this round.
  3. This round consists of a mechanical word to be given to one of the team members who should be able to make the other team member guess the word given.
  4. Does it not sound easy? We have something else for you. Along with the word to be guessed, we have a few taboo words that you are not allowed to use to describe the main word at any cost. Else penalties will be generated.
  5. Coordinators will be asking for the member who would like to describe the word.
  6. Accordingly, the word, along with the taboo words will be revealed to the person.
  7. Each team will be given 5 words with a max time of 1 min for each word. The sooner you’re able to get the other person to guess the word, the higher your score gets.
  8. The team with the highest score wins

description.summary:
Each registered team has to complete a set of tasks testing their marketing skills and design skills. A complete study of the given product has to be undertaken and a final 3D model of the product has to be submitted.
Platorm: Zoom

round_description.name: Round 1: The Pitch
round_description.description:
• A proposal template will be provided. Each team receives a product and is expected to analyze it among the various brands available in the market on several parameters.
  • Participants should come up with an innovative idea to elevate the existing product.
  • A detailed proposal is to be submitted explaining their idea, utility, novelty within the stipulated time.
  • There is a time limit for submission so the proposal should be submitted before the specified deadline.
  • Teams above threshold points will proceed further.


Evaluating Criteria
Quality of the Analysis
Prowess in handling the situation
Innovative idea

round_description.name: Round 2: Design with an innovation
round_description.description:
• The teams need to model all the parts and create an assembly adding their innovative features.
  • Each team has to submit the model in PDF format(assembly- top view, front view and isometric view) via a google form.
  • Any modelling software can be used.
  • A zoom link will be provided to present and explain the model.
  • The final assembly has to be shown in the software by screen sharing.


Evaluating Criteria
Accuracy
Time taken to complete the full assembly
Quality of presentation

description.summary:
What better way to push your technically sound mind to its limits than solving puzzles? Quarter Mile of Invente 2021 brings you the perfect blend of fun and learning in the form of a multi tiered quiz event.

Platform: Gmeet/Discord
No of Rounds: 3

round_description.name: Round 1: Genesis
round_description.description:
• The first round will involve solving a crossword and a puzzle
  • The crossword will consist of 10-15 questions in a particular domain of mechanical engineering

round_description.name: Round 2: Design
round_description.description: Participants will be given a component of which they are expected to produce the engineering drawing

round_description.name: Round 3: Apex
round_description.description: The culmination of the previous 2 rounds, the winners will lock horns and race against time to solve the final quiz/puzzle

description.summary:
Are you a person who likes to play card games like cricket attax or WWE? Or are you person who missed playing these games? Car wars is the event for you! It is a fun filled event to test your technical knowledge and competitive strategy. Additionally, anyone with an interest in automotive field is guaranteed to enjoy this event. The technical knowledge required is beginner friendly but the fun involved is elite.

Platform: Zoom and use of google drive
No of Rounds: 3

round_description.name: Round 1
round_description.description:
In the first round, all the teams would be bidding for the cards with the allotted amount (the cash pool will be provided before the round)[NOT ACTUAL MONEY]. The cards would only have the car's name and photo with the overall rating. There will be a fixed no. of car types and each card will have 5 attributes based on the car's specification. Each team should have at least one car of each category (category of cars will be informed later).
The cars WON'T HAVE THE SPECIFICATION VALUE.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description: In the second round, the teams would be completing tasks to get the values of each specification of their cars.

round_description.name: Round 3
round_description.description:
In the third round, each team would be pitted against another team (based on random draw by the organizers) card clashes will be based on the specifications they received from the second round.
All the rounds from now on will be on a knock-out basis.

Rules for the third round:
  • One versus one
  • Only one person can interact from a team
  • Order of drawing cards should be fixed by both teams
  • A decider question will choose on which team goes first.
  • The team that goes without any cards loses the round.
  • The winners of each clash will move to the next level. This goes on until the final winner is decided.

description.summary:
Life is too short to play a bad game. Join us for a fun-filled day with your friends. Exciting prizes up for grabs!!

Platform: Google forms, Zoom
No of Rounds: 3

round_description.name: Round 1:  20 Questions
round_description.description:
The objective of the Twenty Questions game is quite simple: guess the person, place or thing in 20 questions or less!

Platform: Zoom/Gmeet
  • Each team will have a questioner and an answerer.
  • For each round of the game, the answerer would be given a person( living, dead, fictitious character), place( anywhere in the world) or a thing.
  • The Questioner is supposed to guess the RIGHT ANSWER only by asking ‘yes’ or ‘no’ questions.
  • Once 20 questions are used up, no more questions may be asked.
  • Whichever team is able to reach the answer first, WINS.
  • This will be an elimination round and the qualifying teams move to ROUND 2 of the event.

round_description.name: Round 2
round_description.description:
• This Round will be conducted using the Zoom platform, the link to which will be provided for the selected teams of Round 1.
  • This round will be a fun and interactive one to hype you up for the final round.
  • Both the team members can be present in the meeting for this round.
  • The games include our own twist on the popular game charades along with picture quizzes and so on.

round_description.name: Round 3: SURPRI(ZE)
round_description.description: The Final round will be a surprise round to test the participants’ spontaneity. The winners will be decided on the basis of the consolidated scores of Rounds 2 and 3.

description.summary: Think you have the  Tenz aim? The Hiko clutch genes? the AvgJonas lineups? Here's the perfect opportunity to prove your mettle and kickstart your eSports aspirations. Welcome to the most anticipated event of Invente-6.0. Grab your chance flex your aim and game sense on the server and register now! Let's see if you can CLUTCH... Or Kick.

round_description.name: Rules
round_description.description:
1. Each team will consist of 5 players with no substitutions allowed. All players must give their Riot ID and Tag at least 48 hours before the day of the tournament.
  2. Each team is allowed one timeout during the course of the match in the case of any technical issues that may arise.
  3. Double elimination bracket format will be followed. The grand final will have no bracket reset.
  4. Vulgarity / Toxicity of any kind will not be tolerated during the course of the tournament.
  5. The upper bracket final and grand final will be best of 3 maps while the rest of the tournament will be a single map.
  6. Matches at 12-12 will go into overtime. If there is no winner after 32 rounds, the next round will be the decider.
  7. Uses of any in-game exploits/bugs/glitches will lead to disqualification.
  8. The map pool consists of – Ascent, Bind, Haven, Split, Icebox and Breeze. Choice of map will be done by alternate map bans.
  9. The organizer’s decision will be final in all matters.
  10. Any roster changes have to be reported to the organizers 24 hours before the tournament starts.
